Rectangle2D getDecoratedBounds (Diagram diagram, Figure figure, Rectangle2D rcBounds)

Detailed Description

Date:
08-20-2001
Author:
Eric Crahen
Version:
1.0

Objects implementing this interface are responsible for selecting and configuring a Component that can be used to paint a representation of a Figure on a Diagram.

FigureRenderers can also take into account that some representations (painting highlights, labels, etc) that might fall outside the normal bounds of the Figure.

Member Function Documentation

Rectangle2D getDecoratedBounds ( Diagram diagram,
Figure figure,
Rectangle2D rcBounds )
 

Get the extended bounds for a Figure, these are bounds that a component should use to include a small area for decoration, such as different borders, or arrow heads that fall just outside the Figures normal bounds.

This allows extra space on the display to be associated with a Figure but without affecting the Figures actual bounds.

Parameters:
Diagram  
Figure  
Rectangle2D   reuse a rectangle

Returns:
Rectangle2D

Postcondition:
the bounds returned should not be smaller than the normal Figure bounds
Parameters:
diagram  
figure  
rcBounds  

Reimplemented in DefaultFigureRenderer.

Component getRendererComponent ( Diagram diagram,
Figure figure,
boolean isSelected )
 

This method is invoked when a Component that can render the given item is needed.

Parameters:
Diagram   surface that is being rendered upon
Figure   item to draw
boolean   is the item selected

Returns:
suitable Component

Postcondition:
the Component returned will most likey be changed, in that it will have been reparented & its bounds will be reset. Each time this Component is used this will happen, so generally it is not neccessary for the returned item to bother setting its own size.
Parameters:
diagram  
figure  
isSelected  

Reimplemented in DefaultFigureRenderer.
